name: Cranberry-Filled Orange Pound Cake
description: I made this for a holiday dinner with my family. Everyone loved the cran-orange flavor and the sweet glaze drizzled on top. For a fun variation, include 2/3 cup flaked sweetened coconut when adding the orange juice to the batter, and sprinkle the finished cake with toasted coconut. —Patricia Harmon, Baden, Pennsylvania

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°. Grease and flour a 10-in. fluted tube pan.

In a large bowl, cream butter, cream cheese and sugar until light and fluffy, 5-7 minutes. Add eggs, 1 at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in 2 tablespoons orange juice and the zest. In another bowl, whisk flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture, beating just until combined.
In a small bowl, mix cranberry sauce, cherries and remaining orange juice. Spoon two-thirds of the batter into prepared pan. Spread with cranberry mixture. Top with remaining batter.
Bake 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Loosen sides from pan with a knife. Cool in pan 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.
In a small bowl, mix confectioners' sugar, orange zest and enough orange juice to reach desired consistency. Pour glaze over top of cake, allowing some to flow over sides.

review.reviewBody: This was very good! Made exactly as directions said - only used Dried Cranberries instead of Dried Cherries (that was all I could find). Not overly sweet.........tart with cranberries and loved the cran-orange flavor. Liked using the can of cranberries.....during the spring/summer - very good option instead of needing fresh like you may get in the fall. Everyone liked it except the one who doesn't like cranberries - but even they liked the actual "cake" part. Will definitely make again!
This cake was DELICIOUS...It came out perfect!!!  Nice flavor.  I used Marischino Cherries instead of dried and the filling was delicious.  I'll make this every Christmas Holiday....maybe more.
This is my recipe and I love orange and cranberries together.  I also loved it when I added coconut to the mix.
The center does not cook! After baking for 1 hour it was still gooey! Gross
